TunableList.name: _elements
TunableList.description: The list of elements in the dynamic enumeration.

Tunable.name: DEFAULT_UNDISCOVERED_TEXT
Tunable.description: The default text to use when something hasn't been discovered yet.

Tunable.name: IN_WORLD_HOVERTIP_TEXT
Tunable.description: The hovertip text to show on relics when they're in the world. When they're in the inventory, they'll use the hovertip text tuned on the relic data.

TunableList.name: RELIC_DISCOVERY_DATA
TunableList.description: A mapping of Relic Combo IDs and the data associated with that relic combination.

TunableTuple.name: relic_combo_data
TunableTuple.description: The data about a set of fused objects.

Tunable.name: discovered_picker_description_text
Tunable.description: The relic description text to use if this relic/gem combination is known by the Sim.

TunableVariant.name: hovertip_data
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this combination can also provide it's information to the hovertip of the tuned object.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The objects and potential required states.

TunableVariant.name: object_state
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the participant being checked against Object A must also be in this state to qualify for this relic combination. For example, a crystal is required to be in the high quality state to count towards the high quality relic discovery.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A state value Object A needs to be in to qualify for this relic combo.

TunableList.name: objects
TunableList.description: A set of objects that will provide the information from this relic combo.

Tunable.description: A reference to the second part of the relic.

TunableList.name: object_a
TunableList.description: A set of objects that count towards this relic combination. For examples, since all of the crystals do the same thing, they can all be in one set instead of creating a new entry for each crystal/relic combo.

Tunable.description: A reference to the first part of the relic.

TunableVariant.name: object_a_state
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the participant being checked against Object A must also be in this state to qualify for this relic combination. For example, a crystal is required to be in the high quality state to count towards the high quality relic discovery.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A state value Object A needs to be in to qualify for this relic combo.

TunableList.name: object_b
TunableList.description: A set of objects that count towards this relic combination. For examples, since all of the crystals do the same thing, they can all be in one set instead of creating a new entry for each crystal/relic combo.

Tunable.description: A reference to the second part of the relic.

TunableVariant.name: object_b_state
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the participant being checked against Object B must also be in this state to qualify for this relic combination. For example, a crystal is required to be in the high quality state to count towards the high quality relic discovery.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A state value Object A needs to be in to qualify for this relic combo.

TunableVariant.name: undiscovered_picker_description_text
TunableVariant.description: If this is set to Link To Other Relic Data, instead of using the Default Undiscovered Text, we'll use whatever text is available for linked relic combination. For instance, if this is the tuning for the llama-chaos relic being combined with a gem, this could be enabled and point to the 'llama top chaos bottom' combo so that data will be provided if the Sim hasn't learned about this specific combination yet.

TunableEnum.name: link_to_other_relic_data
TunableEnum.description: The Relic Combination ID to use as a reference to this combination.

TunableEnum.name: relic_combo_id
TunableEnum.description: The Relic Combination ID to use as a reference to this combination.
